attributes.action: To make it illegal to walk any Dog in temperatures above 70 degrees Fahrenheit
attributes.background: Just being left outside without shade or exercise on a hot day can kill your dog! Avoid High Temperatures & Direct Sunlight anything over 70 degrees your dog is at risk from heat exhaustion. Dogs have fur and can’t sweat.  Dogs can only expel heat through their feet and by panting.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for horse owners to pick up their horse droppings
attributes.background: Living in a rural village in Berkshire I often see a lot of horse pooh in the road and never once a person cleaning it up, after my 6 and 8 year old sons pointing this out, why dog owners do why don’t horse owners it is unsanitary to surely in this day and age?

attributes.action: Make a law on age for babysitting and being left home alone
attributes.background: As confusing as it is some people think it's wrong to let teenagers under 16 look after their siblings or other young children, whilst others see no harm As it can be good to trust these days and at other times there are risks..
attributes.additional_details:
Do we educate our children how to deal with emergencies when they arise or how to cook their own food without setting fire to the kitchen.
Just think a law should be in place to protect not only the children but others around and make it a legal age to babysit

attributes.action: Free NHS prescriptions to families of Veterans who receive War Pensions AFCS
attributes.background: Veterans who have been awarded compensation for injuries sustained whilst serving this country are having to pay for NHS prescriptions due to their income being over the benefit rate.There is an employability supplement that equates to the ESA payment yet without the benefits of free healthcare.

attributes.action: Expand the Ancestry Visa to Commonwealth Citizens w/ UK born great grandparents
attributes.background: Currently, the Home Office only allows for Commonwealth Citizens who have at least one UK born grandparent to obtain an ancestry visa. We want to change this and extend this visa to Commonwealth Citizens who have at least one UK born great-grandparent.
attributes.additional_details: Many of us have cousins spread across the Commonwealth who still maintain close family connections with us despite the fact that they have been out of the UK for a few generations. If they wish to return to our island, then we should allow them to do so. In addition most of them have a great understanding of our political system and culture, as well conform to our standards. An act such as this will put us in a better position with the Commonwealth and help fill the Brexit labour shortage.

attributes.action: Give disabled victims of crime funding for support & services to obtain justice!
attributes.background: Disabled people such as those suffering with Autism find dealing with stress and anxiety very difficult, especially when they are victims of crime, it has a huge negative impact on their health, their life both at work and at home as well as their mental well being.
attributes.additional_details: Adequate funding and support should always be available via a bespoke fund for those disabled victims such as autistics or those with mental disabilities ensuring their needs are met to provide the services and support required so the most vulnerable in our society, who struggle to cope with life in general, let alone when they are the victims of crime are not left alone to deal with courts, ombudsman, regulators, MP's, media and police plus all the paperwork and documentation it entails.

attributes.action: Stop giving taxpayers' money to the National Union of Students (NUS).
attributes.background:
NUS is a political organisation not a union and thus must not be given taxpayers money. 
 
http://mallarduk.com/as-a-student-the-nus-continues-to-embarrass-me%E2%94%82-matt-gillow

attributes.action: Make anywhere serving fresh food to be required to provide free tap water.
attributes.background:
I think that any premises serving fresh food should be required to provide tap water and refill reusable water bottles up to 1ltr for free. 
This should include people who aren’t customers.

attributes.action: Give a bursary to those people wanting to train to teach drama
attributes.background: “Acting is behaving truthfully under imaginary circumstances.” - Sanford Meisner. Drama is a subject where students are creative, present in the moment and help them to understand their existence, both physically and emotionally. Teacher training is funded for several other subjects - why not drama?

attributes.action: Urge Thameslink not to makes changes to timetable
attributes.background: Thameslink are planning in May to change the timetables which will mean that commuters will be delayed with for work etc

attributes.action: Ban the use of high-frequency sonic deterrents against young people
attributes.background:
'Mosquitos' are devices deployed outside shops in public areas, with the aim of deterring loitering. They output high-energy 17400Hz waves, only heard by children and young adults.

This 108-decibel assault is painful, causes headaches, and discriminates against all young people.
attributes.additional_details:
Mosquito use infringes on section 14 (discrimination) of the European Convention on Human Rights and the Human Rights Act 1998. The Council of Europe has recommended in 2010 that it be banned.

Mosquito emissions are irritating, painful, and have been compared to forms of torture.

Kent County Council have already banned these on council-owned buildings - why are the Government not at least doing the same?

attributes.action: Improve mental healthcare provisions available for prisoners
attributes.background: Levels of mental health conditions amongst prisoners are disproportionately high compared to those in society.  Despite this, provisions available for prisoners are lacking and the prison environment itself can be a driving force which exacerbates a mental health condition opposed to combatting it.
attributes.additional_details:
90% of prisoners experience some form of mental health condition whilst in prison (Singleton et al., 1998) and acute disorders such as psychosis are extremely high (Bebbington et al., 2016).  Suicide and self harm rates are at an all time high (Fazel et al., 2017).
Whilst HMPPS and the NHS alongside the department of health provide "in reach teams" to help those suffering from a mental health condition, more needs to be done.

attributes.action: Impose a safety check on all animal toys
attributes.background: Animals are just seen as pets to most but to many they are like a family member. Children's toys have to pass a safety check so animal toys should have to too. This issue needs addressing urgently.
attributes.additional_details: There's been many pet deaths caused by pet toys. My friends dog nearly died through playing with a dog toy and my dog was playing tug with one of her toys which the inside was sticking out. A very sharp plastic tube is the only way I can describe it held together with a small piece of sellotape hidden under woven rope. This could have caused my dog serious harm.

attributes.action: Increase armed forces budget
attributes.background: We believe that the armed forces are receiving too little in budget and pay. and we believe that they should get more money due to the fact that everyday their life is put on the line.

attributes.action: Start development of a satellite carrier rocket.
attributes.background: During the 1960s a British rocket named Black Arrow was created that was capable of launching payloads into orbit. However, the program was cancelled in order to save money which left the UK the only country to successfully develop and then cancel an indigenous space rocket.
attributes.additional_details:
-Black Arrow was cancelled in order to save cost, however it was a comparatively cheap rocket design.
-All other countries that have successfully developed rocket technologies have continued to develop them further.
-The lack of our own launch system has led us to rely on foreign countries, such as the Russian Soyuz rocket, which we could be prevented from using their equipment if we fall out of favour with their governments.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of Mental illness in the South Asian and Islamic communities
attributes.background: We would like the government to intervene and educate community leaders, to prevent further stigma and abuse received by South Asians and particularly muslims who suffer from mental health issues, which results in mental health abuse, due to lack of intelligence in the subject by those in authority.

attributes.action: Allow 16 year olds to ride motorcycles with a higher engine size than 50cc.
attributes.background: 16 years old are in danger of being taken off their bikes due to them being restricted and other volumes of traffic going at a much higher rate of speed past them, therefore increasing the accidents including young riders. 125cc would possibly be a better replacement as safer in the long term.
attributes.additional_details: At the moment the law states that 16 year olds cannot ride any motorcycle with an engine size higher than 50cc, this can be very dangerous as many roads now have speed limits way higher than this not allowing you to keep up with traffic or get out of a situation very quickly, therefore increasing the accidents including motorcycles and young riders. 125cc is a more sensible speed which is more reliable for young riders out on the roads at 16. To make sure it is safe for a young driver an additional test could be added allowing you to progress up rather than just a CBT, this time including a small theory

attributes.action: Make homework optional/non-compulsory and ban detention and isolation
attributes.background: Homework stresses young minds out. How are children expected to complete 15 pieces of homework a week for it simply to be glanced at? It is unfair for people to be kept in school against their will, but many schools in the UK do this. Action must be taken!

attributes.action: Create option to sign in opposition to any Parliament and Government petition.
attributes.background: Currently it is only possible to sign in agreement or support of any petition that is put up on this website. This is an obstacle to balanced discussion especially in cases where a petition goes to Parliament for a debate. Essentially this would be similar to MPs 'opposing' a new law, bill, etc.
attributes.additional_details: If approved there would need to be review of the current rules regarding when a governmental response is needed (10,000 signatures) or parliamentary debate (100,000 signatures). Specifically would signatures in support of and in opposition be summed up or counted separately.

attributes.action: Give the RSPCA Statutory Powers to investigate animal welfare complaints
attributes.background: When the RSPCA receives calls on the 24-hour cruelty line its officers are not allowed to intervene and stop any abuse they discover until the Police arrive. The Police having their hands full as it is, cannot always guarantee a quick response which only prolongs the animal's suffering.
attributes.additional_details:
Giving the RSPCA statutory powers (like the Scottish and Irish SPCA) would: 
a) eliminate this waiting for the Police nonsense
b) allow RSPCA inspectors to enter private land where they suspect animal cruelty is taking place
c) allow RSPCA inspectors to remove abused or suffering animals

There are monsters who inflict unjustified suffering on defenseless creatures and RSPCA's role is vital to save animal lives and prevent  cruelty.

attributes.action: Ban perpetrators of domestic violence representing themselves in family court
attributes.background: In domestic abuse cases in family court, the abuser continues to abuse and control their victim by choosing to self-represent. This is a way for them to obtain personal information i.e. medical records about their victim.
attributes.additional_details: Women’s aid are aware of the perpetrators motives and are in agreement the way family courts are run needs to change. Women are losing their children due to domestic abuse even when they leave the abuser the abuse still continues. The abuser uses the family court to obtain personal information on their victim by self-representing. This needs to be stopped. The criminal courts have put this in place so why not the civil courts? Women are being put through massive amount of stress during these proceedings when the protection can be put there! Cafcass also need in-depth training on domestic abuse.

attributes.action: Reconsider licence requirement for small breeders to safeguard endangered breeds
attributes.background: Many dog breeds are endangered and can’t afford to lose breeders. Small breeders with <2 litters yearly in the home are concerned about being unable to meet the expense and requirements of the new licensing laws and may be forced out of business if they chance to make more than £1k in any one year.

attributes.action: Tax Break for citizens who are renting and do not own a home
attributes.background: Government should give tax-breaks to those who are renting. Foreign investment in housing has allowed companies to make housing their business by buying/selling & renting out. This causes house prices and rents to continuously soar and has already made homes unaffordable to middle-class citizens.
attributes.additional_details: Whenever new flats are built some percentage of it goes to council. Then a huge percentage are bought by foreign/local companies. Then whatever flats are left, some of them are bought by people who already have homes. This puts a huge pressure on supply and greatly increases the supply-demand gap that triggers house prices shoot up. Home is a basic necessity as food & water, and therefore it cannot be allowed to become a business. If Government is not doing enough, then people should be compensated.

attributes.action: Ban the sale of all acid that burns the skin on contact
attributes.background: Today I walked into a discount home store and found acid on sale for £1.99. Thousands of lives destroyed for only £1.99.
attributes.additional_details: As a plumber I have used acid before and find it is dangerous even for me to use, even when standing back from it and reaching out to pour it down the drain it can still burn my eyes and face from the fumes. As a result I do not use it for cleaning drains, acid destroys the plug hole and all seals on the pipes. There is no need for it to be used for plumbing. Acids are used in a lot of items from lemons to drain cleaner, however some are diluted and would not cause harm, so i am asking for all acids that burn the skin instantly to be banned outright.

attributes.action: Funding home visits in times of crisis by trained mental health professionals
attributes.background: After a local woman tried to take her life, the community were left horrified in discovering proper professional help was not available to her, and she was left for hours before receiving the help she needed.
attributes.additional_details:
We are calling for more funding and correct training for these circumstances so that no one needing help in times of crisis are left without it. This woman was fortunate to have a strong community of neighbours who were able to help her.

It's easy to point the finger and say people in need should seek help, but what happens when the help just isn't there?

attributes.action: Make laws to prevent the fitting of excessively noisy exhausts to motor bikes
attributes.background: There are an increasing number of motorbikes and cars with exhausts that can be heard through double glazing and from over a quarter of a mile away. They disturb sleep, prevent conversation and cause stress. Their only purpose is to draw attention to the vehicle
attributes.additional_details:
A number of motorbikes and some cars frequently disturb me, often during the night or very early morning. Most people with whom I discuss this have also been disturbed.
One motorcyclist wakes me any time between 5:30 and 6:30am. He starts from his home, which I haven't yet identified, pushing his bike, and starts it up outside my house. He clearly knows it is too loud and avoids disturbing his own family.
The Chief Medical Officer has expressed concern about air and noise pollution.

attributes.action: Make teaching sexual abuse/assualt in more detail part of the curriculum
attributes.background: Many people (adults and children alike) who have been abused often say that they didn't realise what was happening was actually abuse for a very long time.  By educating children about what is abuse will empower them to protect themselves.  Abusers rely ignorance and secrecy.
attributes.additional_details: By talking about abuse of any kind openly and freely we take away the secrecy and make it less of a taboo subject and people may, hopefully, 1. be more aware of how to protect themselves, 2. feel more able to speak up if something does happen to them, 3. make abusers more wary of abusing.

attributes.action: Redefine the term ‘majority’ in regards to referendums as a minimum of 65%.
attributes.background: 52% is NOT  majority; this means that the will of a significant portion of the population goes unheeded. The government needs to redefine the term 'majority' in a referendum to 65% minimum.
attributes.additional_details:
In other countries, such as the US, a major change to the constitution requires two-thirds majority in both the Senate and House of Representatives. The fact that in the UK a result of just over 50% can constitute a major change can and has led to major social divisions within the country whilst also meaning that the will of a significant portion of the population goes unheeded. This makes the country vulnerable to disinformation.

https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-eu-referendum-36306681

attributes.action: Require ride-sharing services to give drivers equity to operate in the UK
attributes.background: To get a license to operate in the UK, all "gig economy" types of companies such as Uber, Gett, Deliveroo, etc. would be required to designate a pool of equity (or cash from its sale) to its workers. This would be distributed on a negotiated per mile/hour basis + a 'time on network' + rating policy.
attributes.additional_details:
Protect Intelligent Systems Workers

Any worker who contributes to an intelligent network, AI or algorithm that will put their long-term work at risk should participate in the long-term equity success of that network or system because they are helping to build it.

The government should make this equity grant a requirement of entry into any city or town and should hold in escrow either equity, funds or both to protect the longterm future of these intelligent systems workers. 

www.found.ee/taxi

attributes.action: Ban plastic food containers at takeaways, food pots and trays
attributes.background: According to World Environmental Forum, we have become too depended on using plastics. More than 8 million tons of it ends up in the ocean every year. If we continue to pollute at this rate, there will be more plastic than fish in the ocean by 2050,”
attributes.additional_details:
Many countries around the world have banned the use of plastics. The U.K. must take action now!

Time is up for plastic use! We must protect our ocean and the next generation!
#Banplasticuse4good #Banplasticfoodpots #Banplastictakeawayboxes

Plastic food pots and trays are often unrecyclable, say councils - http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-45058971

attributes.action: Install a fence or screen in the middle of motorways to prevent rubber necking
attributes.background: Rubber necking creates massive amounts of traffic even on a road that is totally unaffected. For example, an accident on the opposite carriage can cause a queue or a crash due to people looking across the road instead of where they're going. We need to install screens or barriers to prevent this!

attributes.action: Horn honking/sexual slurs shouted out of car windows to women to be an offence.
attributes.background: The majority of women while in public have to endure multiple forms of harassment, from horn honking to misogynistic sexual slurs shouted out of vehicle windows, whether travelling to work or visiting local shops women endure constant verbal harassment. All women should feel safe on our streets.
attributes.additional_details: My personal experience has a 20 year old women living on a main road traveling the 30 minute journey to work I receive upwards of 3 vocal forms of sexual harassment I am made to feel like a piece of meat. Why should this injustice which has occurred for generations in our society be accepted. An online form where victims of this behaviour can report offending vehicle registration numbers to the local authority and a sanction procedure should be in place to prevent these acts being committed.

attributes.action: Scrap the MOT test.
attributes.background: The MOT test is outdated and does not save lives but only costs motorists money.

attributes.action: Require CCJs to be sent by recorded post
attributes.background: CCJs are just sent by normal post. If these are not received or sent to a previous address they are just entered against you. This is completely unfair which if you find out you have one, you then have to pay to get it set aside as you had no chance of defence. This needs to change.
attributes.additional_details: These need to at least be sent by recorded post and not entered if they are not received.

attributes.action: Equal rights for boys up to their 18th birthday to receive the HPV vaccine.
attributes.background: Today 24/7/18, the government announced that boys aged 12-13 will receive the HPV vaccine from 2019. While this is great news,   I would like to petition the government to increase the age limit to the same that is offered to girls, up to their 18th birthday.
attributes.additional_details:
A jab that protects against a virus that causes cervical cancer will be given to boys aged 12 to 13 in England. 
The policy decision brings England into line with Scotland and Wales. 
HPV vaccine is already routinely offered to girls of the same age at secondary school and is free up until they turn 18.
Experts and campaigners have been calling for equal access to the jab, which can also guard against oral, throat and anal cancers.

attributes.action: Provide option to pay an extra 10 to 20% Council Tax & choose where it's spent.
attributes.background:
With all the cuts to services I suggest people are given the OPTION to pay an extra 10, 15 or 20% on their Council Tax via a tick box AND be able to choose where the money is allocated via a few more tick boxes i.e.
- Policing
- NHS
- Schools
- Local Town Council
- Social Services
attributes.additional_details:
Many of us are unhappy & frustrated with the spending cuts that have impacted so many services. There is too much emphasis on keeping Council Tax down without giving people the OPTION to pay more if they want to and have a say in where it is spent. 

I would be happy to pay an extra 10% provided it went on local policing and I am sure many people who could afford it would feel the same, albeit with differing priorities.

attributes.action: Remove anonymity from MPs accused of misconduct.
attributes.background: MPs have voted to grant themselves anonymity if accused of sexual harassment or expenses misconduct. They will remain anonymous while being investigated – and might not be named even if they are judged guilty.
attributes.additional_details: MPs should not have rights above those of ordinary people. Otherwise, even if they get caught, we may never know.

attributes.action: Allow the disabled access to biodegradable single use plastics in any future ban
attributes.background: There has been a considerable number of concerns raised by the disabled community and allies about the need for single use plastics in their lives. I would like the language of any ban on any single use plastics to include an exemption for biodegradable plastics for the disabled community.

attributes.action: Have a Nicola Sturgeon statue in Westminster
attributes.background: I would like a Nicola Sturgeon statue built in the House of Commons.

attributes.action: have Tinnitus retraining therapy in all UK hospitals
attributes.background: about 1 in every 5 people in the UK suffer from Tinnitus and having Tinnitus retrainning therapy in a hospital closer to their house will help them.

attributes.action: Make it a criminal offence to feed and encourage seagulls to nest
attributes.background: The spiralling number of seagulls in our cities and surrounding suburbs are adversely impacting the mental well-being of residents. Their incessant screeching starts in earnest in the early hours and persists for much of the day. They defecate on property, vehicles and washing and attract vermin
attributes.additional_details:
https://www.mirror.co.uk/news/weird-news/residents-declare-war-seagulls-poisoned-6098194
http://www.worcesternews.co.uk/news/13581245.New_crackdown_drawn_up_to_tackle__aggressive__seagulls_in_Worcester/
https://www.economist.com/britain/2017/02/09/britains-war-on-seagulls
https://www.fixmystreet.com/report/26682
https://www.theedinburghreporter.co.uk/2017/02/morningside-councillor-wants-council-to-get-rid-of-gulls/

attributes.action: Enforce a limit on the cost of vehicle insurance for young and new drivers
attributes.background: Insurance in the UK has been continuously on the rise for several years. The cost of insurance for young drivers aged 17 years old even on low powered, low insurance grouped vehicles can run them up to the likes of £1500-£3000 with no cap. The average cost a new young driver will pay is around £2000
attributes.additional_details:
This has been a well known fact for many years that insurance companies have been picking out every penny they can from young and new drivers with no justification. The cost of insurance supercedes the price of many young drivers value of the car sometimes up to 5 times.
This is hindering young drivers from wanting to drive and becoming independent as the cost is becoming extortionate and is only rising every year. There needs to be a cap on the amount insurance companies can charge.

attributes.action: Make Football compulsory for all schools across the UK (Public and State)
attributes.background: Football is the biggest sport in the world with over 1/3rd of England watching the World Cup games that England were involved in. Some children do not get the chance to play football and excel at the sport, public and state schools.
attributes.additional_details: Every pupil deserves the chance to be involved in a team sport, where it is not physical like rugby, which some students do not want to partake in due to fear of injury.

attributes.action: I believe that it should be mandatory for ALL lunch breaks to be paid.
attributes.background: As of right now, when working on the minimum wage, the employee will lose either £36.90 or £39.15 each week, depending on age group. This is roughly £147.60 or £156.60 lost each month. In my opinion, this is outrageous; ultimately feeling like being punished for needing to eat and rest.

attributes.action: Tax financial institutions to pay for social care, instead of personal taxation.
attributes.background:
Banks caused the global financial meltdown and took billions in bailouts from taxpayers. I think they’d should pay this back via a social care levy.
It would also help to restore public confidence in the banks.

attributes.action: Hold a referendum to allow Northern England to claim independence.
attributes.background: Northern England is always the most underfunded out of everywhere in the UK. We in northern England pay taxes, yet it is always the south that spends it. We have the worst public transport system in the UK, and many other services including the NHS receive the smallest amount of funding in England.
attributes.additional_details:
Northern England should be allowed to hold a referendum on whether we should claim independence from England and form our own country within the UK.

Northern England is always forgotten about in the south including Downing Street. The government does not fund or maintain northern England properly as it should. 

We in northern England pay taxes, yet the south spends it. It is time to hold a referendum in Northern England !

attributes.action: Cap Tax Avoidance - Introduce 1% Minimum Corporation Tax based on Turnover
attributes.background: It is not unreasonable to expect that all companies who wish to participate in the UK economy should be treated fairly and equally under the tax legislation.  The minimum corporation tax rate based on turnover should be the mechanism to ensure that this happens.
attributes.additional_details:
The minimum corporation tax can be collected in advance at the point of sales and/or assessed annually based on reported turnover.   The new tax could easily be extended in the future to include all cypto-currency transactions to ensure the tax compliance.

On average, the FTSE 100 companies’ corporation tax expense to turnover has gone from 4% to 1% over the last 5 years and companies like eBay pay even less with 0.2% of their turnover going to the UK Tax-man!

attributes.action: Public transport(bus) to have cabin filters to protect passengers and drivers
attributes.background: high pollution is danger for all of us, the cabin filter will protect and save lives
attributes.additional_details: it was a few documentary on tv shown that danger (heavy) car emission are cumulated in public transport like tram and buses. The ventilate is not an option, a proper pollen filter will make a different and it will save some lives, and help

attributes.action: Increase research and funding into Lyme Diease and co-infections
attributes.background: Lyme Diease and co-infections is a serious infection that isn't being treated correctly by the NICE guidelines please sign this to force the research and funding into this infection and strength the NHS to treat this debilitating Diease
attributes.additional_details: Lyme is becoming more and more reported in the UK and all over the world, case numbers are getting higher. After i become infected i found the treatement given in the UK was not enough and i keep relapsing, because of this ive been forced to go private to get the right treatment we need a cure not symtom management !!

attributes.action: Fine people who call 999 or show up to A&E without life threatening problems.
attributes.background: One in three calls are emergency and life threatening injuries. Two out of three are not. We can prevent wasting £8.50 on those who call 999 or show up to A&E wasting the healthcare’s time when they have other services they can utilise. Fining a person can help to deter these time wasting problems.
attributes.additional_details: 1. https://www.google.co.uk/amp/s/amp.theguardian.com/society/2015/dec/25/frequent-999-callers-nhs-england-ambulance-emergency
